summary: User seeks guidance on proper client instantiation patterns when long-lived server connections frequently drop due to server redeployment. They question whether to reuse a single Connection/WorkflowClient or create new instances per request.
userImpact: Users experiencing connection drop errors need to understand the correct client usage pattern to avoid redundant instance creation and ensure reliable operation across server redeployments.
rootCause: Connection retry logic was not fully implemented in gRPC interceptors; individual calls may fail after retry limit is hit even though the connection can be reused.
proposedFix: Reuse Connection and WorkflowClient instances for the lifetime of the application; the connection will automatically reconnect when dropped. Adjust retry policy based on expected server downtime duration.
resolutionDetails: Confirmed that Connection/WorkflowClient can be safely reused across server redeployments; individual failed calls don't destroy the connection. Related fix in sdk-core PR #213 addresses worker persistence during server downtime.
keyQuote: you can trust the Connection and WorkflowClient instance may be re-used though, depending on your retry policy, in-progress calls may eventually fail if the connection is lost for long enough
